isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9400, AND 9900 MODELS - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 ENGINES - OPERATION

svcsubsecinfo.para: The ECM is connected to the Navistar electrical system at two points (or three points with antilock brakes installed).

item.para: Navistar engine harness 30-way ECM connector (273) connects to ECM. This connector links the Navistar switches, sensors and data links and supplies ignition power to the ECM.
ECM power cable connector (676) supplies unswitched battery power and a ground path to the ECM.

Additionally, with ABS/traction control system, the Navistar 2-way J1922 data link connector (403) connects the circuits to ECM communications connector (406) and is used to provide communications between the ECM and the ABS/traction control system controller.

svcsubsecinfo.para: Refer to the appropriate circuit diagrams in CTS-5119W or CTS-5273W.

svcproc.title: ECM POWER CIRCUITS
svcproc.para: Power is supplied at all times from the positive battery terminal to the ECM over two circuits. The first circuit consists of circuit 14A from the battery positive terminal, a 15A fuse, circuit 14D, connector (675), and circuit 14D to the ECM power connector (676). The second circuit consists of circuit 14B from the battery positive terminal, a 15A fuse, circuit 14C, connector (675), and circuit 14C to the ECM power connector (676).

The ECM is grounded through circuits 11-GA, 11-GB, and 11-GC to a splice. From the splice the circuits are grounded through circuit 11-G, connector (N/L) and circuit 11-G to the negative battery cable.

When the key switch is in the ignition or start position, the ignition relay (462)/R1 is energized. With the relay energized, power is applied to circuits 13H, 13J and 13F, I1 ignition adapter (494), circuit 13Z, 5A fuse F9-B, circuit 13D, connector (2), and circuit 13D to the ECM (273).
